wheel_sensitivity_popover.text: Be careful! This setting will RELOAD the page and is SAVED on the pc. (Default is 1)

NewSettingControls.save_graph_pos_tooltip: Save the current layout on the server (as "Server-Saved" layout)
NewSettingControls.save_current_layout_tooltip: Download the current graph, as is into a json file
NewSettingControls.load_layout_tooltip: Load previous saved graph (.json) into current panel (hit "Save Graph Position" if you want the loaded graph to be saved as the server layout)

unhide_popover.text: Are you sure to unhide / expand all nodes?

item0.footer:
**__General Movement:
 -Click and drag the mouse on a node to move it
  -Only in "Server-Saved" layout will each move be saved and shared
 -Click and drag outside of a node to move the graph
 -Scroll to zoom in and out

item1.footer:
**__Selecting nodes:
 -Hold Shift or Ctrl and click on nodes to select them
  -Selected nodes have a pink color
 -Hold Shift and drag the mouse to create a selection box

item2.footer:
**__Right click a node to open the context menu:
 - Download: Download corresponding Snap! file.
 - Mark as favorite: Mark a node for all to see.
 - Edit: Change node values.
 - Collapse: Collapse all nodes beneath into one.

item0.footer: Double click on a node to open it in Snap!

item1.footer:
**__Activating JavaScript:
 -To be able to use Smerge, JavaScript extensions have to be activated in Snap!
  -Open the Settings menu and check "JavaScript extensions".
 -Click on the "Activate JS and Import Data" block to import your data.

item2.footer:
**__Post to Smerge:
 -Click the "Post to Smerge" block in the tab "Variables" and enter a short description of the new version to upload the changes to Smerge.

item0.footer:
**__Merge two nodes:
 -Select two nodes and click the "New Smerge" button in the right lower corner, then confirm the merge.

item1.footer:
**__Solving merge conflicts:
 -If two project versions are too incompatible with each other, they create a merge conflict. Merge conflicts have to be resolved manually. 
  -Double click on a merge conflict to open an overview of conflicting elements. 
  -Select whether to proceed with the left or the right version of the project.

item2.footer:
To change to the old Smerge merger, right click on the "New Merge" button in the lower right corner. The color will change to orange, indicating the change.
Hint: The old merger is capable of merging more than two files at once.

item0.footer:
**__Project setting options:
 -Change Password: updates the password or sets a password if none was set before (requires a password input)
 -Change Project Name: updates the project name (requires a password input)
 -Change Project Description: updates the project description (requires a password input)
 -Delete Project: deletes the project (requires a password input and a confirmation; caution: the deletion is final!)
 -Language: allows to choose the app language

item1.footer:
**__Graph setting options:
 -Save Graph Position: saves the current layout and updates it for all users (if using the Server-Saved layout option).
 -Layout: changes the graph layout. Options include:
  -Dagre: traditional hierarchical layout; default option. 
  -Server-Saved: the custom option saved on the server. 
  -Random: places the nodes randomly.
  -Grid: shows all nodes in the graph on a grid.
  -Circle: organises the nodes into a circle.
  -Concentric: organises the nodes into concentric circles.
  -Breadth First: organises the nodes in levels, according to the levels generated by running a breadth-first search on the graph.
  -Force (Cose): sorts nodes according to an implementation of the CoSE algorithm.
 -Change Scroll Speed: updates the scroll speed used for zooming in or out.
 -Change Project Colors: allows to update the color scheme for normal nodes, nodes marked as favorite and merge conflict nodes.
 -Old Project View: switches to the old Smerge project settings view.

item2.footer: Clicking on "Save Current Layout" downloads the current graph layout as a JSON file to the users' system. The file can be loaded by clicking the "Load Layout From File" button which allows the layout described in the file to be restored.

NameDialog.description: The given value will be displayed as name for this node in the graph.
NameDialog.label: Node Name
